values: We Rejoice to Suffer for You: Pastoral Pain and the People’s JoyWe Rejoice to Suffer for You: Pastoral Pain and the People’s Joy

Why does the apostle Paul speak so much about himself and his suffering? Because his suffering for the sake of others makes the love of Christ tangible to them.Why does the apostle Paul speak so much about himself and his suffering? Because his suffering for the sake of others makes the love of Christ tangible to them.
